bug.author: fonnesbeck
bug.summary: Altair chart sizes not realized by `altair_chart`
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
height and width properties of Altair charts are often not realized by the plot that appears in Streamlit <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
When I use code like the folllowing: scatter = alt.Chart(pitcher_pitches).mark_circle().encode( alt.X('platex', scale=alt.Scale(zero=False), axis=alt.Axis(grid=False)), alt.Y('platez', scale=alt.Scale(zero=False), axis=alt.Axis(grid=False)), color='fxtype:N' ).properties(width=200, height=200) st.altair_chart(scatter) It generates a 200x200 plot, as expected: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/81476/69498671-1524fd00-0eb0-11ea-8557-d994f66b35c9.png></denchmark-link>
However, in general it does not. For example, setting properties(width=200, height=400) returns the same square plot. Strangely, setting it to properties(width=400, height=400) returns a rectangular plot. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/81476/69498685-4271ab00-0eb0-11ea-9b0f-2844dd3f10b5.png></denchmark-link>
Setting the width argument in altair_chart to values other than zero does nothing to change the output. <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
The chart should be drawn at the dimensions specified in the properties method. <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
See above <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: (get it with $ streamlit version) Python version: 0.50.2 Using Conda: yes OS version: macOS Catalina Browser version: Chrome 78

I will assign to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/dcaminos>@dcaminos</denchmark-link> who is working on this.
Closing this since a putative fix was merged. If this issue comes up again, please file a new issue. Thanks!
